= The HandlerSocket class methods =
Version: 0.1.0

== HandlerSocket::__construct ==
Creates a new HandlerSocket object

{{{
HandlerSocket::__construct ( string $host, string $port [,  array $options ] )
}}}

=== Parameters ===
|| host || MySQL Server host name ||
|| port || MySQL Server for HandlerSocket port number ||

=== Return Values ===
Returns a new HandlerSocket object.


== HandlerSocket::openIndex ==
Before executing table operations, you need to open an index to work with.

{{{
public bool HandlerSocket::openIndex ( int $id, string $db, string $table, string $index, string $fields )
}}}

=== Parameters ===
|| id || HandlerSocket ID ||
|| db || database name ||
|| table || table name ||
|| index || index name ||
|| fields || get field names (comma-separated) ||

=== Return Values ===
Returns TRUE if the success; FALSE if not.


== HandlerSocket::executeSingle ==
To read or insert or update or delete record from a table using an index.

{{{
public mixed HandlerSocket::executeSingle ( int $id, string $op, array $fields [, int $limit, int $skip, strint $modop, array $values, array $filters ] )
}}}

=== Parameters ===
|| id || HandlerSocket ID ||
|| op || operation ('=', '>=', '<=', '>', '<', '+')  ||
|| fields || key to find, which must an arrayref whose length is equal to or smaller than the number of key columns of the index  ||
|| limit ||  maximum number of records ||
|| skip || number of records skipped before retrieving records ||
|| modop || the modification operation. ('U', 'D') ||
|| values ||  new value for the row (For the 'U' operation) ||
|| filters || filter options. ||

=== Return Values ===
Returns execute results.


== HandlerSocket::executeMulti ==
Multiple operations can be executed in a single call.

{{{
public mixed HandlerSocket::executeMulti ( array $requests )
}}}

=== Parameters ===
|| requests || array of executeSingle parameters ||

==== Notes ====
HandlerSocket::executeSingle($requests[0][0], $requests[0][1], ...),  HandlerSocket::executeSingle($requests[1][0], ...) ... same behavior.

=== Return Values ===
Returns execute results.


== HandlerSocket::executeUpdate ==
To update a record from a table using an index.

{{{
public mixed HandlerSocket::executeUpdate ( int $id, string $op, array $fields, array $values [, int $limit, int $skip, array $filters ] )
}}}

=== Parameters ===
|| id || HandlerSocket ID ||
|| op || operation ('=', '>=', '<=', '>', '<')  ||
|| fields || key to find, which must an arrayref whose length is equal to or smaller than the number of key columns of the index  ||
|| values ||  new value for the row (For the 'U' operation) ||
|| limit ||  maximum number of records ||
|| skip || number of records skipped before retrieving records ||
|| filters || filter options. ||

==== Notes ====
HandlerSocket::executeSingle($id, $op, $fields, $limit, $skip, 'U', $values, $filters) same behavior.

=== Return Values ===
Returns execute results.


== HandlerSocket::executeDelete ==
To delete a record from a table using an index.

{{{
public mixed HandlerSocket::executeDelete ( int $id, string $op, array $fields [, int $limit, int $skip, array $filters ] )
}}}

=== Parameters ===
|| id || HandlerSocket ID ||
|| op || operation ('=', '>=', '<=', '>', '<')  ||
|| fields || key to find, which must an arrayref whose length is equal to or smaller than the number of key columns of the index  ||
|| limit ||  maximum number of records ||
|| skip || number of records skipped before retrieving records ||
|| filters || filter options. ||

==== Notes ====
HandlerSocket::executeSingle($id, $op, $fields, $limit, $skip, 'D', NULL, $filters) same behavior.

=== Return Values ===
Returns execute results.


== HandlerSocket::executeInsert ==
To insert a record from a table using an index.

{{{
public mixed HandlerSocket::executeInsert ( int $id, array $values )
}}}

=== Parameters ===
|| id || HandlerSocket ID ||
|| values || insert values  ||

==== Notes ====
HandlerSocket::executeSingle($id, '+', $values, 0, 0, NULL, NULL, NULL) same behavior.

The 3rd argument must be an arrayref whose elements correspond to the 5th argument for the corresponding open_index call.

=== Return Values ===
Returns execute results.
